DataElement.preferredName: Medical Condition Reuse Template Observation Outcome Data Negation Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A reusable template description of a sign, symptom, disease, or other medical occurrence. EXAMPLE(S): death, back pain, headache, pulmonary embolism, heart attack, pregnancy, flu, broken bone, menstrual period, depression OTHER NAME(S): Clinical Events, Medical History Specifies whether, when the observation event occurred, the finding communicated by the value attribute was NOT found. NOTE(S): This attribute should only be used when the terminology used for the defined observation result value is not itself capable of expressing negated findings (e.g., ICD9).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Condition Reuse Template Observation Outcome Data Negation Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the study or practice of medicine.:A state of being, such as a state of health.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
